instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight issue
threads.message:
Hey guys.

This macbook has backlight issue. When it came in it had no backlight. After sometime display came back - and then started flickering on and off pretty fast for about 10-20 seconds. So i guess whatever the issue was on its way out. Now black screen when i shine a torch can see visual.

I measured

12.67v on ppbus
3.42v present <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>

i get 0v on both sides of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> AND L7710
however <DIODE>D7720</DIODE> and l7720 have 5v on both sides

is this faulty <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight issue
threads.message:
First check F7700 and resistance to ground at both pins of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>.
Post <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> voltage at pins 5, 18, 17, 11.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight issue
threads.message:
hey there,

backlight is back and hasnt disappeared since. i have done heaven for around 2 hours... not sure what it was but there was alot of dust... maybe that was the issue?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a backlight issue
threads.message: Maybe bad contacts on LCD connector...
